KerbalAlarmClock.documentation: This service provides functionality to interact with Kerbal Alarm Clock.

AlarmWithName.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Get the alarm with the given <paramref name="name" />, or <c>null</c>
if no alarms have that name. If more than one alarm has the name,
only returns one of them.
</summary>
  <param name="name">Name of the alarm to search for.</param>
</doc>

AlarmsWithType.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Get a list of alarms of the specified <paramref name="type" />.
</summary>
  <param name="type">Type of alarm to return.</param>
</doc>

CreateAlarm.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Create a new alarm and return it.
</summary>
  <param name="type">Type of the new alarm.</param>
  <param name="name">Name of the new alarm.</param>
  <param name="ut">Time at which the new alarm should trigger.</param>
</doc>

get_Alarms.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
A list of all the alarms.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Action.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The action that the alarm triggers.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Action.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The action that the alarm triggers.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Margin.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The number of seconds before the event that the alarm will fire.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Margin.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The number of seconds before the event that the alarm will fire.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Time.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The time at which the alarm will fire.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Time.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The time at which the alarm will fire.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_ID.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The unique identifier for the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Name.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The short name of the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Name.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The short name of the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Notes.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The long description of the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Notes.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The long description of the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Remaining.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The number of seconds until the alarm will fire.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Repeat.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Whether the alarm will be repeated after it has fired.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Repeat.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Whether the alarm will be repeated after it has fired.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_RepeatPeriod.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The time delay to automatically create an alarm after it has fired.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_RepeatPeriod.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The time delay to automatically create an alarm after it has fired.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_Vessel.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The vessel that the alarm is attached to.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_Vessel.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The vessel that the alarm is attached to.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_XferOriginBody.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The celestial body the vessel is departing from.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_XferOriginBody.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The celestial body the vessel is departing from.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_get_XferTargetBody.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The celestial body the vessel is arriving at.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm_set_XferTargetBody.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The celestial body the vessel is arriving at.
</summary>
</doc>

Alarm.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Represents an alarm. Obtained by calling
<see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.Alarms" />,
<see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmWithName" /> or
<see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmsWithType" />.
</summary>
</doc>

AlarmAction.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
The action performed by an alarm when it fires.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: DoNothing
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Don't do anything at all...
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: DoNothingDeleteWhenPassed
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Don't do anything, and delete the alarm.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: KillWarp
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Drop out of time warp.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: KillWarpOnly
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Drop out of time warp.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: MessageOnly
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Display a message.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: PauseGame
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Pause the game.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Raw
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm for a specific date/time or a specific period in the future.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Maneuver
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm based on the next maneuver node on the current ships flight path.
This node will be stored and can be restored when you come back to the ship.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: ManeuverAuto
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
See <see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmType.Maneuver" />.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Apoapsis
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm for furthest part of the orbit from the planet.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Periapsis
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm for nearest part of the orbit from the planet.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: AscendingNode
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Ascending node for the targeted object, or equatorial ascending node.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: DescendingNode
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
Descending node for the targeted object, or equatorial descending node.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Closest
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm based on the closest approach of this vessel to the targeted
vessel, some number of orbits into the future.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Contract
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm based on the expiry or deadline of contracts in career modes.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: ContractAuto
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
See <see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmType.Contract" />.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Crew
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm that is attached to a crew member.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Distance
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm that is triggered when a selected target comes within a chosen distance.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: EarthTime
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm based on the time in the "Earth" alternative Universe (aka the Real World).
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: LaunchRendevous
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm that fires as your landed craft passes under the orbit of your target.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: SOIChange
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm manually based on when the next SOI point is on the flight path
or set to continually monitor the active flight path and add alarms as it
detects SOI changes.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: SOIChangeAuto
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
See <see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmType.SOIChange" />.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: Transfer
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
An alarm based on Interplanetary Transfer Phase Angles, i.e. when should
I launch to planet X? Based on Kosmo Not's post and used in Olex's
Calculator.
</summary>
</doc>

values.name: TransferModelled
values.documentation:
<doc>
  <summary>
See <see cref="M:KerbalAlarmClock.AlarmType.Transfer" />.
</summary>
</doc>
